result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcos A Avila was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order to suspend Huber privileges for 2 weeks, and loss of all good time, due to jail violations.

Defendant Marcos A Avila by video, in custody.  Crystal Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant had motioned the court by letter requesting a furlough.  State objected to the motion.  Court denied the motion.  2:24/2:26
Motion hearing on April 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by ADA Crystal Long, State objects to court granting a furlough.
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - conviction DNA on file
filed by atty Peter Masana
filed by atty Peter Masana

Defendant Marcos A Avila in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF443 and 14CF570. In 14CF570 Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 months, 10 days in jail, with Huber work release.  $518.00 costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Jail start on 03-11-16 7:00 pm. 1 day sentence credit.  Must submit DNA sample.  15CF443 Dismissed.

Defendant Marcos A Avila in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Reset requested.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Marcos A Avila in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. Twenty days to file motions.
